name: Suite Novotel Lille Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a couple for 2 nights in August, also happened to the be weekend of the big markets. Room was a large for what we had been staying in other hotels. Separate bath & shower in a large bathroom. Toilet with basin in it's own room. Large comfortable bed with good pillows.
reviews.title: Suite is Sweet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice touch having a fridge, mircowave & sink, also a welcome pack of calming teas. Free wifi & movies.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel right opposite Lille Europe railway station

reviews.text: Just walk out of the Europe rail station & across the road could not be any closer.
reviews.title: Suite Novotel Lille Europe

reviews.text: On the other side of the station is a large shopping center & only a short walk to the main square.
reviews.title: Good value, functional hotel

reviews.text: We booked at Novotel for 1 night, purely because of it's location - directly oposite the Eurostar station and ten minutes' walk from the centre.
reviews.title: Unexpected

reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise! The hotel is modern, well appointed and clean. Check-in as well as check-out were quick and easy and Fabian at reception was extremely helpful and friendly throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.text: The room was large with a double bed for us and a sofa-bed for my daughter - using the screens as a divider, provided privacy for both our daughter and ourselves. It was also really convenient having the toilet separate from the bathroom, which had both a shower and a bath with a separate handshower.
reviews.title: Just don't eat here

reviews.text: Coffee and Tea were provided with a separate basin where the kettle could be filled, rather than the usual having to use the bathroom basin.
reviews.title: Best for Tourists Arriving at Gare de Lille Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room also has a large desk with two chairs and free wi-fi, ideal for business.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service

reviews.text: Good location next to main railway station and about 10 mins walk to Grand Place. Nice rooms with great facilities incl free Internet access , free on-demand movies, tea/coffee and even a microwave. Staff were friendly and helpful. Highly recommended..,
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We booked this on the basis of previous reviews and in general this was a pretty good stay. The staff are friendly, its in their job description to be and to buck the trend of miserable French hoteliers. In fairness they succeed at this and we were made most welcome.
reviews.title: As good as the previous reviews?
So convenient if rail travellers.
reviews.text: The room is spacious, clean and comfortable. Having your own fridge and microwave is good and the Suitebox entertainment centre is top notch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downers, car parking is expensive (20 Euros a day) and access at the front of the hotel is minimal. There's a side road just before the hotel and I found a place everyday. You are supposed to put a ticket on before 19:00 but if you've UK plates on your car the wardens never bother.
reviews.title: Good hotel for families, but maybe not so good for couples

reviews.text: Parity between the Euro and sterling makes Lille a very very expensive city. Two (small) beers and a hot chocolate will set you back over £12.00 for example.
reviews.title: Basic and over-priced

likes.disliked: — It was far too basic for the price

reviews.text: This is an excellent choice if you are planning to visit Lille by Eurostar. The hotel is immediately opposite the terminal building, and is itself within three or four minutes walk to the large Euralille Shopping Centre and around 10 minutes to the centre of the city.
reviews.title: The Suite Hotel is perfect, especially if you're on Eurostar for Lille

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, modern, efficient, extremely well-equipped (no charge for wi-fi internet, a standard that needs to be set elsewhere) with separate bath tub and shower. The staff were helpful, friendly and efficient - helping us with a baby cot for our 22 month old instantly. They all spoke excellent English.
reviews.title: Excellent - as good as everyone says!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The impression was of an extremely well-run establishment, with well-motivated staff and a high standard of maintenance. They were very happy to store our bags on the day of our departure, and although we didn't bother with the 12Euro breakfast, there were options available at Eurolille.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Overall, if you are travelling by Eurostar for a city break, this should be high on your list of possible hotel choices.
reviews.title: Great trip

reviews.text: Excellent!
reviews.title: returning soon

reviews.text: Exceeded all my expectations, the room is as pictured (maybe even better!) It was a good size, well kept, clean and the double glazing ensured it was sound proofed from any traffic.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and good facilties in room

reviews.text: The staff was friendly, helpful and generally really nice.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

likes.disliked: — Red wine at the bar (not good)

reviews.title: My first choice in Lille
reviews.text: Can't recommend it high enough! Excellent value for money! Esp with the free internet and films/music in the room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is only across the road from the euro star station, and easy walking distance to the city centre.
reviews.title: Good location, practical accommodation

likes.disliked: — The plastic feel of the toilet 'pod'

reviews.title: Agree with all the other reviewers
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel this weekend just gone and must say how excellent the whole experience was. The rooms are very large and spotlessly clean (if a little 70s retro). All the staff are really helpful and polite. Lille is a lovely place with some fantastic buildings and shops. For a glass of wine you must definitely go to the old town to La Parts des Anges, loads of choice by the glass. Our favourite restaurant was Le Barbu d'Anvers. The food was fantastic and the staff really brilliant. Went here twice for lunch. Would recommend Lille and would most definitely stay at the Suitehotel again.
Went for the weekend with my family in tow (Baby, toddler, dog and wife) and had a very nice stay.
reviews.title: Modern hotel at a really great price point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very modern and quite. They were clean and very efficiently designed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, all mod cons, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is a short walk to the 'old city' where there is great food, shopping and ambience.
reviews.title: Ideal citibreak hotel

likes.disliked: — Paper cups provided in the rooms for tea and coffee

reviews.title: Above average
reviews.text: Only thing to watch for are the Roma that are living near by (permanently located about 150 meters underneath the hotel along the motorway)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Very modern. Large, spacious rooms. Free internet, TV and movies. Even a mini-kitchen with a microwave! Situated right above Lille Europe station. At 75 euros for one night without breakfast it was good value compared to some much more basic and grubby French hotels we've stayed in. Fine staff, free coffee and cake. Recommended.
reviews.title: Very spacious

likes.liked: — Great location, very spacious and free movies

reviews.text: I did a weekend trip from London with three others. Originally it was going to be five of us so there was an option to book a single and a double bed for one of the rooms. It's basic but rooms are large and toilet separate from showers which is a good design. Don't bother with food there but you're only ten minutes walk into the city. For what we needed it was really convenient.
reviews.title: Fit for purpose, good overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very impressed with this hotel. We were there yesterday and the previous two days, and found it to be a superb place for a few nights' stay. Despite being one of the modular modern 'kit' hotels, it provided everything we needed, including plenty of space. There seemed to be very few staff, but this was never a problem as every need was catered for and those few staff were very friendly, and enjoyed each other's company (a smiling, contented staff is usually a sign of a well-run establishment). The hotel was conveniently located (literally across the road from the Eurostar station), just a ten minute walk from Lille centre. We chose to have breakfast which was self service continental style (as you would expect in France!) but a reasonable range of foods and drink was available. Eating, bar and reception are all in the same area at the entrance, which is perfect for short stays and business overnighters! Our room was very warm and we had to turn the air-conditioning up high and the temperature down low, but I still found it too warm to sleep comfortably - a top-sheet option rather than just duvet or no-duvet would have been useful.
reviews.title: friendly, efficient, functional

reviews.text: Stayed in a family suite with our two children 14 & 11. Room was spacious, clean, and more importantly had a bed each for the kids who no longer want to share a sofa bed! We got a great deal which included unlimited movies and free wifi so the kids were happy! There was a small fridge and a kettle in the room. the hotel is opposite the railway station and less than a 5 minute walk to an indoor shopping centre where there were fast food cafes and a supermarket which proved very handy for picking up breakfast. Lille centre was about a 15 minute walk away, plenty of lovely restaurants, cafes and shops, a very pretty town. We used Lille as a base to explore Bruge, Brussels, Paris (about 2 hour drive). We had a great time and couldn't fault the hotel, the staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. There is not a restaurant within the hotel but that suited us as we like to eat out most of the time, however the hotel are happy for you to bring food in ie from takeaways or supermarket. We had a great time!
reviews.title: Great stay, ideal base for visiting local area!
Horrible experience
reviews.text: Booked online, drove over a hour to the hotel which was to be a stop off before going home the next day. When booking I booked a family room which had a double bed and two singles, we have two children and a baby. In all the previous hotels I have stayed in the baby does not count towards occupancy (as per the Marriott we stayed in the night before, Premier Inns we have used, Disney Hotels, even Travelodges for goodness sake). We tried to check in but were told that it was forbidden for the baby to stay in a room with us and we would have to book another room. We chose to cancel our booking and book a ferry home instead. What a stressful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used this hotel as a stop over from TGV to Eurostar. Due to a break down on TGV arrived two and a quarter hours later - 12.15 a.m. However, we were still met by a very welcoming, polite member of staff who explained the facilities offered at this hotel. Our room was excellent, spacious, modern and very clean. Tea/coffee making facilities, breakfast bars, sweets, bottled water - all complementary. Liked the fact that the tea/coffee making area had its own sink and tap. Fridge and microwave also in room. Comfortable bed, good size bathroom including shower cubicle, wash basin and bath, lovely large white fluffy towels. Hotel very handy for Eurostar and TGV - just over the road and the pretty town of Lille a few minutes walk away. ask at reception for a map. Good check out time of 12.00 especially if like us you are spending the day in Lille, the hotel also stored our suitcases for us. Check out was quick and trouble free - excellent service, staff giving advice on the area. When returning for our suitcases again wonderful service and helpful staff. We would certainly stay in this hotel again and would recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Large, very clean, well planned room with comfortable bed. Fridge, microwave and safe in room. Good tea/coffee making facilities with snacks in room and more available to buy in lobby. Excellent location and pleasant staff. Air con was quiet and worked well. Only drawback was the toilet which was clean, but could have done with a good glug of bleach.
reviews.title: Good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually stay in smaller hotel but after the price was more expensive I chose this based on reviews and I wasn't disappointed. The staff were incredibly friendly, they spoke fantastic English (my French is not up too much!) and nothing was too much trouble. The room was a really good size, complete with a small but perfectly adequate fridge, a microwave and a kettle and not to mention a good choice of teas and coffee.
reviews.title: Best Lille hotel

reviews.text: You were also greeted with a free bottle of mineral water in the fridge every day, and it was lovely and cold. There was also a small selection of cereal bars and dried fruit snacks free everyday.
reviews.title: The staff makes this a 5 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was a generous size with ample storage space for your own toiletries but there was free items if you needed them and I actually used the fizzy bath tablets a few times! There was a bath and a walk in shower, the latter which was amazing!
reviews.title: Great short or business stay

aka: Suite Novotel Lille Europe Hotel Lille
description: 3 star hotel with 126 inviting 30 m² suites. Enjoy our free unlimited Suitebox service, which includes WiFi and hardwired internet, calls to landlines within France, video and music on demand, music, photos and more. Located in the city centre, across from Lille Europe station and not far from Lille Flandres station. 24 hour services including Boutique Gourmande refreshments, fitness area, business corner. Bar, free massages on Thursdays and public outdoor pay car park. Accessible facilities.
